ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 541
ygData.msgSnippet: HI everyone, I ve been reading this list but havent posted before. I have a 51 warrior and a 44 druid. I am currently working on leveling my 31 cleric. I
ygData.messageBody:
HI everyone,
I've been reading this list but havent posted before.
I have a 51 warrior and a 44 druid. I am currently working on leveling my 31
cleric. I mainly have her to help my guild with rezzes. Otherwise my warrior
is my favorite. I've been playing a little over a year.
I agree with you Barto on the lag in the baazar. I cant move or get my mouse
to work either. I actually walk in there frame by frame and I have a very
upgraded computer. I'm not doing any selling or buying but my husband does
sell a lot, so of course I had to go check it out. I've turned my clip plane
almost all the way down and look down a little. thats help me move some. I
also found because the lag is so bad that people have been doing a lot of
selling out in the spires.
How does everyone feel about the new interface? I'm having a hard time
getting use to it, like someone else said I too am having a problem with the
chat box on the bottom, I've been moving it to the top and faded it so there
is no background. It makes it easier to target. What I dont like is that we
cant see ourselves anymore. What I mean is in the other interface when I am
running I could see behind me when I clicked on the inventory, but now we
cant do that anymore. All in all I like this new look and the many options
its given us.
Hope to talk more soon.
Doneka Pullemall
51 warrior
Bristlebane
> Message: 2
> Date: Sat, 27 Jul 2002 01:35:06 -0000
> From: "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@...>
> Subject: bazaar
>
> Went there this morning to set up some sales. Lag was terrible. It
> was hard to even get my cursor on target. I suppose it will be ok
> once I get set up to sell, but the set up is terrible. Move cursor.
> Not on object. Move a bit more. Not on object. Move back. Click.
> Don't have object. Click again. Hmph. Had object but didn't know it,
> and just put it back. Click...
>
> Took so long that I didn't finish setting up before I had to log. I
> wouldn't have logged if I could have left my toon to do business
> while I was gone, but no such luck.
>
> I just gotta get another machine, faster connection, and retire from
> my job so that I can play all the time.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
